titles.title: TITLE Act
Taiwan Identification Terminology and Label Enhancement Act
TITLE Act
To require agencies to use the term "Taiwan" instead of "Chinese Taipei", and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

bill.summary:
Taiwan Identification Terminology and Label Enhancement Act or the TITLE Act
This bill requires all federal agencies to use the term Taiwan instead of Chinese Taipei.
The use of Chinese Taipei is allowed in (1) historical context to explain China's attempt to control Taiwan through persuasion and coercion, or (2) the formal title of a federal document. Agencies must update their websites to reflect this term no later than 14 days after enactment.
